events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred on the highway involving their vehicle and another driver, initiating the claim process.
Upon review, the claim has been categorised under 'Auto Accident' in accordance with the described incident involving a vehicle collision.
An insurance agent has been assigned to oversee the claim and assist the customer throughout the resolution process.
The insurance team formally acknowledged receipt of the claim and confirmed receipt of all initial documentation provided by the customer.
Additional documents such as the police report, photographs of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates were requested to proceed with the claim.
The customer promptly submitted the requested documents, including police and accident reports, as well as detailed repair shop estimates.
A claims adjuster has begun a thorough investigation to verify the details of the collision and estimate the extent of vehicle damage.
The investigation into the accident circumstances and damages has been completed and a report generated for claim assessment.
A settlement amount was proposed to the customer, covering the repair costs and associated damages from the auto accident.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the prompt handling and communication throughout.
The claim has been officially approved following the customer's agreement to the settlement terms and completion of all assessments.
Payment covering the approved settlement amount was issued to the customerâ€™s designated account without any delays.
The claim process was successfully completed and closed after confirming the customer received payment and was satisfied with the outcome.
All claim records and correspondence have been archived securely for future reference and compliance with company regulations.
